title: Enter our competition to win a Namedsport nutrition bundle worth £500 (plus 10 runner-up prizes)
content:
Celebrate the 2021 Tour de France with our Namedsport nutrition bundle prize draw, with a grand prize worth £500 up for grabs.

By entering our competition, you’ll also be automatically entered into our runner-up prize goody bag giveaway – a £50 bundle of Namedsport nutrition products for ten winners.

Namedsport is Italy’s leading sports food brand with a strong presence in elite cycling. Many of today’s leading cyclists rely on Namedsport products to fuel training and race performance. You can find them at your local bike store, Sigma Sports, Halfords online and selected Evans stores.

To celebrate Namedsport’s continued sponsorship of all three Grand Tours and its support of elite teams, BikeRadar readers can enter to win £500 of ‘Tour-proven’ energy and hydration foods.

The £500 bundle includes:

  • Rocky 36 per cent protein bar, salty peanut – x2 (12 × 50g per pack)
  • Energy bar – banana x 2 (12 × 35g per pack)
  • Energy bar – strawberry x 2 (12 × 35g per pack)
  • Energy bar – apricot x 2 (12 × 35g per pack)
  • Total Energy Carbo Gel – agrumix x 2 (24 × 40ml per pack)
  • Total Energy Strong Gel – lemon x 2 (24 × 40ml per pack)
  • Isotonic Power Gel cola-raspberry – x 2 packs (6 gels per pack)
  • Isotonic Power Gel orange – x 2 packs (6 gels per pack)
  • Isotonic Power Gel grapefruit-lemon – x 2 packs (6 gels per pack)
  • Isonam Energy – lemon (480g) × 2
  • Isonam Energy – red orange (480g) × 2
  • 4 Fuel Protector – orange/carrot/lemon x 2 (14 x 119g)
  • 4 Fuel Recharge – x 24 (20 sachets per pack)
  • Fuel Active – orange x 2 (20 × 170g per pack)
  • Hydrafit + bottle 2020 – 400g × 2
  • Gym sack
  • Black bottle
  • Elite bottle cage

Named Sport

Ten runner-up prize winners will also be in line to win:

  • Energy bar – Banana 12 x 35g
  • Isotonic Power Gel multi flavour – x 2 (6 gels per pack)
  • Black sports bottle

This competition is open to UK residents only, including the Channel Islands, aged 18 years or older. Entries close on Sunday 18 July 2021.
author: BikeRadar
